reviews.text: The Akron zoo has come a long way in the past few years. It was in need of a makeover and the zoo stepped up and made the changes necessary to become a top attraction. The flow of the zoo is nice and easy for everyone to follow. The new animals and they’re habitats are great. Lots of viewing options and great photo opportunities. Also the additional attractions like playgrounds, merry go round, and others add to a great experience. The lights in the winter time are great too. Plus the majority of the animals are still on display. Love the zoo.

Fantastic little zoo, just outside the heart of Akron. Construction going on, right now, to create a new Africa Savannah, opening in 2019, and a new Asia exhibit to open in 2020.
The single greatest thing about the Akron Zoo is it offers a perfect flow for visitors. Too many zoo have you backtracking over areas you have visited to see other exhibits.
The Akron Zoo has a flow that is unmatched and you see all the exhibits, with up-close-and-personal exhibits the kids will absolutely love.
The kids will be mere inches from penguins, jaguars, and snow leopards!

We regularly visit different zoos and animal sanctuaries and this one is close enough to us to visit just for the day and not be extremely exhausted. It is under construction right now so that’s a bit of a bummer , but the staff is super nice and informative and the grounds are spotless! Worth the money for sure !

LOVE the Akron Zoo!! It is a great little zoo for when you don't want to spend 8 hours walking around. You can easily see everything in a few hours.
  They regularly have special exhibits and animals on display. Makes for a nice change of pace. 
  My kids are older now and we all still love going to the Akron Zoo!

This is a great little zoo, especially for children.  They don't have hundreds of different animals but have most of the more interesting ones. The place is clean and well laid out...a great way to spend 2 or 3 hours.

I love visiting this place!! The grounds and mansion are well maintained and a joy to share with the family. The summer is a beautiful time to walk the grounds and see the gardens. Winter is a great time to walk the property, green house and mansion to see all of the spectacular Christmas lights and decorations inside and outside. The murder mystery is a fun outing while touring the mansion, the actors are funny and they put on a good show. Again, I absolutely enjoy visiting this place and all the events they have to offer. Great history at Stan Hewitt!

This is one of the most beautiful places in Ohio. I am lucky to be a member here and to get to experience it in every season. The grounds are always gorgeous any time of year, but fall is my favorite. Their Christmas events are absolutely wonderful and I have made it a tradition with my family. It is always a joy to see this immaculately preserved home and attend all their events.

I visited the Hall on a recent trip to Akron. I had a morning free, and saw it was the #1 attraction on trip advisor. I went on a guided tour, which was excellent. I think it lasted about 90 minutes. We did not get to see all of the house, but saw a lot of it. Our guide said the house has about 95% of its original furnishings, and it really is spectacular. I was visiting in November, so the gardens were not in good form, but I would enjoy coming back to see them if the opportunity presents itself.

Loved it. We toured the house on the regular house tour. Then we went back for the Murder Mystery Dinner.   It was the 10th anniversary for it, and we had never been.  It was incredibly done.   Before we went to the dinner, we took the nooks and crannies tour. We had a wonderful time on both of the tours and definitely loved the Dinner theater. Please visit if you can.

One of Akron's greatest treasures.  Taking a tour of the manor house and grounds is totally worth it.  The house is furnished such that it actually feels like it's still being lived in, which gives you a better impression of what it was like to live there.  If you're visiting during nice weather, don't forget to tour the grounds as well!
Nice place to take the kids. Nice opportunity to tour a part of history. I love the old homes, church and more. Staff is very friendly. The gift shop is neat.
Great way to spend a couple hours with the family. Here for the Maple Festival. Breakfast was great!
Great place for the kids. Good exercise. Everything is spread out. Nice people. Wear boots. Kinda muddy. Overall great experience.
Enjoyed a Christmas lantern walk thur the village. They told stories at each house that waa interactive with everyone. Very neat experience.

They do much more there, but my wife, mother-in-law and I went there for the annual craft show the host and it was great. Plenty of parking and a very nice place for the whole family. I recommend looking them up to get more information on more of the things they do aside from just the craft show we went to.

If you're looking for an inexpensive, extremely amazing fun and family friendly atmosphere for a great time out, look no further. This is an amazing organization that strives to give you the best experience.
I spend a fair amount of my summer here and it doesnt break the bank and always leaves me with a smile.
If you haven't gone, change that now!

What great place to take the family! Different things to check out inside the park. Reasonable prices for entry, food, beverages and souvenirs. The mascots are extremely entertaining. Parking isn't too bad. Half of the park gets blasted with sun as it sets so keep that in mind when you buy tickets, we were roasting had to leave our seats and walk around till the sun set, but now I know for next time.
Fun local events and good food! Overall, great fun for the ticket price!

I bought an italian sausage. I waited 10 minutes for it. When it came out it was a brat. I was like whatever and went to put mustard on it. There was honeymustard in the regular mustard dispenser. Lowkey highkey disappointed .

We go to games all the times...
Always a great time!!!#

This place shouldn't even be called a university.  The administration of this place is disjointed and full of attitude.  You should be working and with and supporting the kids attending, not the other way around.  I am so glad my kid isn't going there anymore, you all should be ashamed of yourselves.

This campus is one of the most unsafe I have had the displeasure of being on, I have lived here for 2 years now and there have been numerous break-ins a few violent disputes that Firearms have been involved with and the campus is scattered in a shotgun formation so that walking to class can take up to 25 minutes even if you live in the dorms. They have a nice gym that's about the only good thing I can say about the University of Akron, horrible School horrible town and horrible people, I would not recommend going here the price is not worth what you pay for.

The campus is honestly really beautiful. I went here for my undergraduate degree and am now working on campus (not employed by the university, just located in an outside agency's office here) and I couldn't be happier. There are a lot of really great professors and plenty of things that go on during the semesters on campus.

We have had such a great experience so far with U of A. As a parent of a freshman this year, this school has been so helpful answering all of our questions and directing us in this entire endeavor. Move in day was easy and well organized. We believe that our son made the right choice by choosing the University of Akron and we are very excited to see where this education will take him. I have a feeling it will ‘Zip’ him into a future of many successes!
Everything is a hassle, good teachers are rare, hard to find a good advisor that will actually help. Financial aid office is worthless, probably going to transfer

Expand your taste buds to include this restaurant. No matter what your diet restrictions, there are many choices for Vegetarians, Gluten-free, and those with food allergies as well as those who are hungry. There are many choices and all of the selections are tasty. Try their fresh hummus, it is outstanding. Service is excellent.

This was the first Aladdin's i ever ate at.  It was where i became a hummus addict. Oh my goodness.. It is so good..  I love the Chicken Salad Rolled the best of all the things i have tried.. It is my go to meal..A long time ago they offered a kids peanut butter and jelly pita.. My daughter didn't want it, so it was another first for me.. my first ever peanut butter and jelly combination.. and it was good.. 
The desserts there look like you are in Dessert Heaven, but I like the brownies at the register the best..  It is delicious..

All of their food is delicious and good for you. Personally like the Len-chili and the hot mint tea on a blustery day. Also recommend the tiramisu, it is so good! Cute location! Parking can be trouble during busy times, but there is more parking in the back.

I only ordered an appetizer when i went because I wasn't super hungry when my friends went but it was one of the most delicious things I have ever had, I was surprised by how much I liked it. Everyone else in my group seemed to like their food too, no complaints from anyone.

Aladdins is always one of my favorite chains.  They have a decent selection of Mediterranean food with a slight twist. This coupled with fresh juices and smoothies is a winning combination. The chain also makes very decadent deserts. Although this particular Aladdins has fewer selections for desert.

Stopped in today to try something new while in the area. The spaghetti with meat sauce was basic. The salad was lettuce with what tasted like vinegar only as a dressing.  We ordered two of the showboats. Nothing special about them either.  I would not choose to come back here, but would if family members wanted to. I'm not expecting that to happen.

I stopped in with my fiance and our God son and almost felt as if we had done something wrong by coming in by the look we received. Nonetheless, we placed our carryout order and found a seat to wait for our order to be prepared. After maybe 5-7 minutes an older gentleman emerged from the rear of the establishment and approached our table. He asked if we were ordering food or needed help. This wouldn't have been an issue had it not been for the fact that there was at least 3 other parties all of whom had come in after us. I only gave 2 stars because the ice cream was good. But from our experience, save yourself a uncomfortable experience and order from doordash or uber eats if you're a "person of color" Or better yet, order from a place that serves people of all demographics without bias.

Friendly staff and great location. Ice cream is great. Really takes you back with atmosphere and the feel. That being said. It's a little overpriced and the portions of food from the Trecasso menu were lacking. All in all not bad but wouldn't spend the money again.

Best milkshakes in Akron and some great Italian food too. They have some old school classics like Phosphates for $1.95. I swear by the strawberry milkshake and my girlfriend on the chocolate - each are $5.30 and are in a large foam cup filled to the brim. come by and check it out! Better than emidios in my opinion.

We've never eaten the food here...just ice cream. When my son was a little boy I took him for ice cream. It was so good. My son is now a man with young children of his own. We stopped in to get some ice cream, my son ordered something to drink. I don't remember what exactly it was. It tasted aweful. My granddaughters wanted sundaes and so did I. The ice cream and toppings were as good as ever, with the exception of one thing. No whipped cream. They no longer serve their sundaes with a whipped cream topping. The owner needs to cut down the prices on sundaes since he cut back on quality and taste.

What is a sundae without whipped cream. Unless you don't like it. I can go to Burger King and they ask if you want your milkshake topped with whipped cream. 

I can go to McDonald's and get a hot fudge sundae...with whipped cream.

I went with a friend one afternoon to get some hot chocolate. We were treated poorly by the manager because we were waiting for it to cool down some. We began sipping it and continued with our conversation. We were asked if we were done and ready to leave. Is there a 15 minute time limit for sipping hot chocolate and conversing? If there is please post it.

I'm staying at the hotel this restaurant is in so I went here for a late dinner on Monday food came out cold the staff on that night was flirting with a couple women at the bar so I think they were more concerned with buying these women drinks obviously .I went back on Wednesday (as i said I'm staying at the hotel.)the food came out cold again but this time the manager(arron)was working he had them make me a fresh plate instead of just reheating it,he and the server apologized the food was great and I will be back. I recommend this restaurant if you appreciate great customer service and great food.

Amazing food and amazing service. Everyone was super nice, and gave us recommendations. The pizzas were some of the best we had. Lots of flavor, especially on the chorizo one. For the amount of the food, the price is really fair honestly. We're a bunch or college students so price was a concern, but we ended up spending around $10 each so it wasn't bad at all. Would definitely recommend checking out Bricco if you're in town, I know I'll be back.

I enjoy this place pretty often. Danm good gourmet food and stiff drinks. Whether you are feeling fancy or feeling causal this bar/restaurant is a great choice. I recommend the duck entree, med well to well done.
First time to the restaurant.  Went early. Jerrod was very good server. Food was good. I know it's not there fault, but be prepared for the street construction outside the restaurant.

If you want more for less! This is your spot 

The food wasn’t the best and it is more expensive than the portion they provide. The water comes without a straw you have to ask for it, and the food didn’t even have flavor. Waste of my money and time I paid $45 and I’m not even full. The hummus taste sweet? Huh???

Go somewhere else.

Beats the pants off of olive garden. But then again,  ketchup on lasagna noodles beats olive garden. It's a really cool place inside. There's a train car, and an elevator table and a few other cool places to eat. Not what you'd expect from a chain restaurant. Prices are very fair and service is always top notch. Ask for Jimmy if you can. He's so personable and doesn't just treat you like another table. Where else can you get spaghetti with meatballs, a piece of delicious sweet Italian sausage, and crispy garlic bread for only $14? Parking is a breeze and its laid out so that even when it's crowded, you're not right on top of people.

Used to love going here with my grandparents when I was young. The food tastes different now but the atmosphere is the same. My kids like it here because there is always something to look at and the bread is still really good.

Great place for larger group lunches during the work day or a neat place to have dinner on the weekend.  They accommodated our party of 10 for lunch, we were served in a timely manner and the food was great.   Ive also attended a retirement luncheon here with 50+ people and the experience was usual.   Ample servers assigned, food came out hot and was still great.

Lose yourself in this unique Italian restaurant... sample their sourdough bread with the amazing butter spread. Order some pasta to fill up on... and to top it off. A divine piece of Italian cream torte... I'm salivating just thinking about it! Or go for the more traditional cheesecake... ☆☆☆☆ definitely the flavor overload you were looking for!

The only thing good about this restaurant was the decor. It was very unique inside with a trolley car. It wasn't packed when we went so the service should be spot on. It wasn't as we all waited 15 min for drinks and I waited 30 additional min for my adult beverage... Food wasn't great either. My lasagna was just sauce and pasta with hardly any meat on it. Didn't really taste great either. It seemed like teenagers were running the place and they didn't seem like they wanted to be there. Will never go back... Had better Italian food at Angie's Italian restaurant in Barberton.

An Akron classic. If you live here, you've heard of it. After 30 years this was our first time here. Date night. Good atmosphere, mood lighting, etc. Service was wonderful. Food was delicious. We had a good experience. Baked Brie was amazing...amazing.  The steak melted in your mouth. It is on the pricey side. Which has and will continue to keep us from being regulars but recommended for those special occasions.

This was my first visit and I was very impressed with the food, the service, and the personal attention from the owner.  It's rare to find such a place these days.  There is free parking directly across the street although you might to take a taxi or ride-share so that you can properly enjoy a some of the very good wines and spirits on offer.  Excellent steaks and plenty of other options for those who prefer something other than beef.

Wonderful dining experience. A menu and specials full of outstanding options, including vegetarian and vegan, which is difficult to find in Akron. First class atmosphere. Everything you could ask for in a first-class dining experience. As others have pointed out, the prices match the quality. Relatively high-priced for North East Ohio. This is balanced by some great choices in reasonably priced wine. As a wine drinker, the reasonable wine prices balance off the menu prices. There is a good reason they now have three restaurants in the area.

My husband & I visited this fun restaurant on a trip to Akron. Service was excellent; our waiter was extremely helpful in guiding me thru the menu,  offering gluten free choices. He even asked the chef about preparing the fish special gluten free, which chef was only too happy to do :). Loved our little private curtained table & all the colorful paintings of faces with enormous chins  - so much humor in those! Yes, the bill was a little pricey but it was a special evening.  Enjoyed it!

The food was great, but tremendously overpriced. The drinks are nearly in line with drinks everywhere else, though might be worth the increase in price as the drink I had was the smoothest I've ever had. It's a nice dining experience to have once, but I'm not sure it'll be something we do often.
This is where I worship God every Sunday. All are welcome to come and her the word of God. Either at 10 am or 1130 am
Awesome wedding, very clean organized facility.
is it any umc in akron that r gay friendly if someone can let me now thanks
Awesome church had a great time!!!

This is a very lovely pretty  church. I was a member of the old one that burnt down which was pretty too. It's been along time since I have been there. But this church is as giving, friendly, and welcoming  as ever. It has a choir that sings beautifully . Friendly greeter and ushers. And a most friendly congregation.  Also a pastor that keeps you engaged with a great sense of humor.  Thank you for welcoming my family.

Beautiful, old church.  Marble is from Italy during the depression, stations of the cross from Czechoslovakia.  Wonderful community of people.  Small church, seats about 300.  Been a member for over 25 years.
Absolutely beautiful Church. The staff is super welcoming and friendly. Sad to say you don't always find that.
There for son cyo basketball game
Wonderful place uplifting Spirit Airline...
Wonderful Italian parish.
Wonderful people here & such a nice place.
We praise God. And welcome one and all
Love and spirit filled. Compassionate  and welcoming
Love everything about this church... It was my first home church
Wonderful place!!! Feel the love there. Not judgemental and ver uplifting
This friendly open & affirming congregation welcomes everyone. Music is on the contemporary side with solid preaching by Rev. Rhinesmith.
Great, inclusive place that welcomes all people
Went there for an AA meeting
Supportive, open, and welcoming church to Everyone.
